1:
A gentle answer turns away anger,\q but a harsh reply stirs up anger even more.
\q1
2:
When wise people speak, they give praise to the value of knowledge;\q2 foolish people continually say foolish things.


\q1
3:
Yahweh sees everything that is happening;\q2 he keeps account of the evil and of the good.
\q1
4:
A person who can give healing with what they say is like a tree that gives life;\q2 when someone lies to you, it can feel like they have crushed you.


\q1
5:
A fool has contempt for his father when he disciplines him,\q2 but the one who learns from correction has insight.
\q1
6:
In the families of those who do right there are great treasures,\q2 but the wealth that the wicked have gives them great troubles.


\q1
7:
The wise scatter knowledge about like the farmer scatters his seed,\q2 but the hearts of fools are not so generous.
\q1
8:
Yahweh hates it when the wicked offer their sacrifices,\q2 but when those who please him pray, he is delighted.

\q1
9:
Yahweh hates the way the wicked live,\q2 but he loves the one who runs after what is right.
\q1
10:
Yahweh will discipline those who lose their way,\q2 and those who hate correction will die.


\q1
11:
The places of death and destruction are known to Yahweh;\q2 how much more does Yahweh know everything within the minds of the people he has made?
\q1
12:
The one who thinks he is better than anyone, he resents being corrected by anyone;\q2 he thinks he is so smart, he will never talk with one who is wise.


\q1
13:
When people are happy, they have smiles on their faces,\q2 but sadness is so strong it crushes the person.
\q1
14:
The longing of the one who is wise is to gain more knowledge,\q2 but foolish people only say foolish things.


\q1
15:
Every day for one who is oppressed is misery for him,\q2 but those who have a happy heart, for them life is a never-ending party.
\q1
16:
It is much better to have only a little and to give Yahweh the honor he deserves,\q2 than to have great wealth along with much confusion.


\q1
17:
It is better to have a simple meal with vegetables when there is love in the home,\q2 than to enjoy a delicious meal served by people who hate you.
\q1
18:
When a person is angry, he stirs up more arguments,\q2 but one who does not quickly become angry, he is able to stop an argument and make peace.


\q1
19:
The life of a lazy person is like someone trying to walk through a hedge of thorns,\q2 but those who do what pleases Yahweh are like those who are walking on a level highway.
\q1
20:
A wise child brings happiness to his father,\q2 but it is a foolish person who despises his mother.


\q1
21:
Foolish people enjoy their folly;\q2 those who have insight live a good life.
\q1
22:
When there is no one giving advice, plans go wrong,\q2 but with many advisors, they will succeed.


\q1
23:
People rejoice when they give a good answer,\q2 and how nice is the right word spoken at the right moment.
\q1
24:
The path leading to life goes up, away from death;\q2 he follows that way and turns from the place of the dead.


\q1
25:
Yahweh destroys the generations of proud people,\q2 but he protects the little owned by a widow.
\q1
26:
Yahweh hates what wicked people are thinking about,\q2 but when people say what is kind, they are pure.


\q1
27:
The thief brings many troubles to his family,\q2 but the one who refuses to accept bribes will live.
\q1
28:
The people who do right think carefully before they answer;\q2 it is like the wicked pour out of their mouths all kinds of evil when they talk.


\q1
29:
Yahweh is far away from wicked people,\q2 but he listens to the prayers of those who do what is right.
\q1
30:
When people smile, it makes them happy,\q2 and good news brings healing to the body.


\q1
31:
If you pay attention when someone corrects you,\q2 you will stay among those who are wise.
\q1
32:
The one who refuses to follow discipline, despises himself;\q2 the one who receives correction gains understanding as well.


\q1
33: The honor that Yahweh deserves will be the lesson that will teach you wisdom,\q2 and then humility comes before honor.
